title: 114_s1433
content: The "Improving Driver Safety Act of 2015" may be cited as the short title. It includes provisions for distracted driving incentive grants. Section 405(e) of title 23, United States Code, is amended to include distracted driving issues in the State's driver's license examination and prohibits texting through a personal wireless communication device while stopped in traffic. The amendment includes prohibiting drivers under 18 from using a personal wireless communication device while stopped in traffic and updating distracted driving enforcement grants. The amendment allocates a percentage of grant funds to states meeting specific criteria related to text messaging laws and distracted driving enforcement. In fiscal year 2017, states eligible for grants must meet certain requirements, including increased fines for repeat violations and a law prohibiting drivers under 18 from using a personal wireless device while driving. Grant funds must be used according to specified conditions. In fiscal year 2017, states receiving grants can use up to 25% of the funds for projects under section 402, related to distracted driving enforcement. In fiscal year 2017, states receiving grants can use up to 25% of the funds for projects related to distracted driving enforcement. In paragraph (9)(A)(i), the provision regarding operation while temporarily stationary because of traffic is being removed. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration must submit a report within 180 days identifying barriers to collecting data on wireless device use while driving and provide recommendations to address these barriers.
